body.name: Thermalright Peerless Assassin 120 White ARGB CPU Air Cooler,6 Heat Pipes,TL-C12W-S PWM Fan,Aluminium Heatsink Cover, AGHP Technology,for AMD AM4/AM5/Intel LGA 1700/115X/1200/2011(PA120 White ARGB)
features: 【Better cooling】 With Full electroplating reflow welding process, the main body of the twin towers is sprayed with white paint at the nanoscale, the effective heat dissipation area is 9600cm². The offset asymmetric layout is allowed to installation on first graphics card slot, leave room for memory-chip, so that installation of the cooler is unrestricted, so that the can achieve excellent heat dissipation performance during work.

【Product specification】Thermalright PA120 White ARGB; CPU Cooler dimensions: 125(L)x135(W)x157(H)mm (4.92x5.31x6.18 inch); heat sink material: aluminum, CPU cooler is equipped with metal fasteners of Intel & AMD platform to achieve better installation, double tower cooling is stronger.

【2 PWM Fans】Model:TL-C12W-S; Standard size PWM fan:120x120x25mm (4.72x4.72x0.98 inches); Product weight: 1.02kg(2.25lb); fan speed (RPM): 1550rpm±10%; power port: 4pin; Voltage:12V; Air flow:66.17CFM(MAX); Noise Level≤25.6dB(A), The high-brightness LED atomizing fan blade can effectively reflect the light, making the RGB lighting effect softer, the mother board can be used to control the synchronized lighting model.

【AGHP technique】6×6mm heat pipes apply AGHP technique, Solve the Inverse gravity effect caused by vertical / horizontal orientation, cpu cooler TDP is 245W. 6 pure copper sintered heat pipes & PWM fan & Pure copper base. When CPU cooler works, match with ultra-silent airflow fans, aim to extreme CPU cooling performance.

【Compatibility】The CPU cooler Socket supports: Intel: 1150/1151/1155/1156/1200/1700/17XX/2066/2011, AMD: AM4/AM5; For different CPU socket platforms, corresponding mounting plate or fastener parts are provided.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Premium Aluminum Heatsink Cover Dual anodized Aluminum cover not only offers great appearance of cooler, but also protects heatsink fins from scratches. AGHP (Anti-Gravity Heat Pipe) Technology Common heat pipes heavily depend on gravity to achieve optimal performance. Heatsink equipped with THERMALRIGHT Special design AGHP Heat Pipes is not affected by the mounting direction. This ensures user’s cooler experience in different computer case designs. Dual TL-C12W-S Fans Well optimized fan blades balance output between airflow and noise, the TL-C12 fan is an all-around choice for cooler and case use. Featuring S-FDB bearing for quiet motor operation and long-lasting life time.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 30, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A budget cooler that stands above the rest.
reviews.reviewText: I purchased the Thermalright PA120 Black CPU Cooler for my 7700x and it's been fantastic. The twin towers with their advanced cooling technology keep my CPU temperatures around 75°C on average, and under heavy load, it barely reaches 85°C. Installation was straightforward, thanks to its compatibility with both Intel and AMD sockets. The dual PWM fans are impressively quiet yet effective. For its price, this cooler is a great deal, offering top-notch cooling performance. Highly recommend it for anyone looking to keep their CPU cool efficiently.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 27, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Inexpensive, effective, easy to install
reviews.reviewText: I got this so I could partially rebuild my kid's pre-built that overheats and runs really noisy with it's tiny little cooler on a 5700g and the results were great as far as thermals, and with athe new case I got, aesthetics are pretty darn good. As much of a Noctua fan boy as I am I'd have no hesitation to use one of these on builds that have space for them.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 20, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Excellent fan and heatsink setup! It was easy to install with my build. The temps are low and it is almost inaudible. Two things made it dicey: The size made hooking up power cables around it a little difficult and it overhangs the memory slots, so hook those up before the heatsink. Also you need access to the back of the motherboard for a support bracket and rails so it's good to install those before mounting the motherboard in the case. It looks really good and it is a quality addition which is excellent value for the money.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 7, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars found out these are better than AOIs
reviews.reviewText: I've been a proponent for AOIs for a long time. I had a NZXT x63liquid cooler for almost 3-4 yrs. And I installed an MSI liquid cooler in my son's PC build. That one was about 2.5 yrs old. I installed some Corsair light strips RGB set to monitor my son's CPU temperatures. Recently, I noticed my son's computer was off and he said he did not turn it off. When i turned it on, I noticed the RGB light strips turned red. I checked the CPU temp and it was through the roof.My sister had an extra NZXT x73 after the original one installed in her NZXT build FAILED (she bought a nicer one and NZXT send her a replacement x73 for the one that failed.) I got a new case and bought the X73 off her for cheap and installed it into my new case.I just built a new pc for hubby and one of the components I bought was the gray Peerless Assassin. I thought to myself, "Self, do you want to install a cooler that is 'install it and forget it' or one that requires a bit more attention and if it fails, you won't know until the temps make the computer shut down?" I decided for "install it and forget it."When my son's AIO cooler failed, I had not installed the Assassin in hubby's build yet. So, I installed hubby's Assassin into my son's computer. Since hubby's build is a Christmas present, I ordered a 2nd Peerless Assassin (white). Those two computers are set! The temps stay cool and easy to clean/blow out when they get dusty. The motherboard RGB settings are set to CPU temps on all my builds. I will leave my computer alone for a couple years and probably get an Assassin for myself eventually because of the reliability. Hubby and I are not big on gaming, and my son does Flight Simulator on his pc. These coolers ROCK! The value for the money is awesome, and super easy to install, too. Highly recommended.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 9, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Effective CPU cooling at an affordable price
reviews.reviewText: Back story...and review.In 2019 I retired from the Navy and relocated to the Philippines. As a retirement give for myself I built a PC with some modest components purchased from Amazon. That included a MSI B450 Tomahawk mother board and a Ryzen 5 2600 CPU. The system worked great for my needs in stock configuration with no overclocking. A few months ago I experienced a problem I have never experienced. While encoding a video the computer just crashed. This happened a few times and through some troubleshooting I determined it was CPU heat related. I cleaned the fans and the problem sort of went away. My idle temperature still hovered between 45c and 50c. I decided two upgrades were in order...Change the CPU to the Ryzen 5 5600X and the Peerless Assassin 120 cooling solution over the wraith cooling included. Because of a Typhoon the CPU arrived almost two weeks before the cooler. So I installed the CPU with the wraith cooler to test.Encoding the same video so I could compare apples to apples here are the results:Wraith cooler: Minimum Temp 41.6C, Max Temp 81.5C, CPU 4.51GHZ, 194 FPS average.Peerless Assassin: Minimum Temp 38.4, Max Temp 59.1, CPU 4.62GHZ, 200 FPS average.Room ambient temperature is 25C and the the temperature inside my computer case during encoding reached 29.8CSide notes:The Peerless Assassin comes with Thermal Right TF7 thermal paste. However, I did not use. I chose to go with Gelid GC-4 thermal paste.I bought the white fan with the black case because no one sees it where it is located and the white version qualified for free shipping.Originally there were two intake and one exhaust fan in the computer. I have installed a second exhaust fan. All fans except the CPU are now controlled by Fan Control based on a CPU Temp curve.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 30, 2024
reviews.reviewText: cools my 5800x well. kinda deafening out of the box, but with arctic a10 fans it's even cooler and quieter

Para el precio no tengo quejas.Mantiene a buena temperatura un Intel 12700k.A pesar de tener 2 detalles;Uno, el espacio para RAM no fue suficiente en mi caso (G skill ripjaws v), sin embargo el diseño para montar los ventiladores permite lidiar un poco con el problema.Dos, el cable splitter Y para ambos ventiladores venia defectuoso y no servía. Se logró conectarlos por separado pero no es lo ideal.A pesar de eso, por el bajo precio e increible rendimiento no tengo quejas.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on October 29, 2023
reviews.reviewText: The media could not be loaded. First off I wasn't expecting this to cool my 7700x but I was certainly wrong. The package arrived a bit late because of low stock I think 🤔; well it's on the table now as I opened it to see a pearly white radiator with white fans no argb tho. It was placed in a nr200 case which I had a AIO before but needed more space so tried this out and was pleased when I went in the bios to see temps under 50°, fan are silent enough but rpm is not as fast as the noctua fans and if you're not pushing too much load it's perfect for recording music and playing games overall it's a good deal 🤝

Lo uso para un 13600k, y jugando cyberpunk mantiene 71C grados lo considero una temperatura excelente para un disipador de aire. Cuando ando solo navegando por internet las temperaturas rondan entre los 38 a 42 grados. Lo elegí por qué no requiere mucho mantenimiento. Clima de la CDMX funciona bien.

De fácil instalación en socket AMD AM4, El peso no tan excesivo para dañar la placa. El tamaño es muy bueno (si a tu gabinete le caben ventiladores de 14 in. posiblemente quepa sin problema) y las temperaturas comparado con el "Wraith Prism" son una enorme diferencia, antes con carga llegaba a 95° ahora no pasa de 55°, sin agregar mas ventiladores al gabinete. Tardo en llegar puesto que fue enviado por Amazon US pero llego en excelentes condiciones.

reviews.reviewTitle: Mejor de lo que me esperaba el mejor enfriamiento por torre
reviews.reviewText: La computadora al estar sin uso llega a 37º o 36º en juegos de procesamiento no tan pesados (medio) 45º y tiene un limite de temperatura a 56º de hay no pasa incluso con juegos muy exigentes incluso la grafica es tan recta que no hay picos de caloraunque es un procesador semi básico (para algunos) se calienta mucho y era algo sumamente ilógico llegando a los 86º que es el limite del procesador (se pasma todo y tienes que reiniciar la computadora)aun utilizando el enfriamiento de stock a la máxima velocidad llegaba a tener ese problema (probé con todo pasta, bajar frecuencia del procesador, velocidad máxima etc, etc)he de aceptar que el ventilador de enfrente lo cambie por un corsair de 2400 rpm pero incluso la maxima velocidad que manejo no me ha excedido ni los 1800rmp asi que los ventiladores que vienen por base siento que seran mas que suficiente
